sentences.en: A few years ago there was unrest in the country at large.
sentences.cn: 几年前全国发生了动乱.

sentences.en: Carrie listened, but with a feeling of unrest.
sentences.cn: 嘉莉听着, 但心里感到不安.

sentences.en: Industrial unrest and cheaper imports played their part in the company's reversal of fortunes.
sentences.cn: 工业动荡和比较低廉的进口使公司形势恶化.

sentences.en: People are predicting civil unrest in the area.
sentences.cn: 人们预言该地区将发生动乱.

sentences.en: The real danger is civil unrest in the east of the country.
sentences.cn: 真正的危险是该国东部地区的民众动乱。

sentences.en: The unrest capped a weekend of right-wing attacks on foreigners.
sentences.cn: 周末右翼分子对外国人的攻击最终演变成了这场骚乱。

sentences.en: The unrest has cast a pall over what is usually a day of national rejoicing.
sentences.cn: 动荡的局势给往常举国欢庆的日子蒙上了阴影。

sentences.en: There are growing signs of more broadly-based popular unrest.
sentences.cn: 越来越多的迹象表明，民众骚乱呈现扩大化趋势。

sentences.en: There could be more unrest, but I wouldn't exaggerate the problems.
sentences.cn: 可能会有更大的动荡，不过我想也不必夸大问题。

sentences.en: There is growing unrest among students in several major cities.
sentences.cn: 在多个大城市里，学生骚乱正愈演愈烈。

sentences.en: There is growing unrest throughout the country.
sentences.cn: 全国各地日益动荡不安。

sentences.en: There was a faint feeling of unrest at the table.
sentences.cn: 餐桌上稍微有一种不安的气氛.

sentences.en: They accused him of fomenting political unrest.
sentences.cn: 他们指控他煽动政治动乱。

sentences.en: This issue is creating unrest on the backbenches.
sentences.cn: 这一问题引发了后座议员的不满。

trans.tran_cn: 动荡，不安定，骚乱，风潮，乱腾
trans.tran_en: a political situation in which people protest or behave violently
